title: Charging Rebels, Fleeing Allies: How Syria's Bashar Al-Assad Reached Russia
content: Syrian President Bashar al-Assad was on Sunday forced to flee the country after rebels seized the capital Damascus, ending his 24-year rule.
summary: Syrian President Bashar al-Assad was on Sunday forced to flee the country after rebels seized the capital Damascus, ending his 24-year rule.

title: South Korea President Banned From Foreign Travel After Martial Law Fiasco
content: South Korea's justice ministry said on Monday it had slapped a travel ban on President Yoon Suk Yeol.
summary: South Korea's justice ministry said on Monday it had slapped a travel ban on President Yoon Suk Yeol.

title: "Need To Preserve Syria's Unity, Sovereignty, Territorial Integrity": India
content: India said Monday it is monitoring the situation in Syria and called on all stakeholders to "work towards preserving the unity, sovereignty, and territorial integrity" of the West Asian country.
summary: India said Monday it is monitoring the situation in Syria and called on all stakeholders to "work towards preserving the unity, sovereignty, and territorial integrity" of the West Asian country.

title: Watch: Gigantic Santa Claus Made Using 5,000 Drones Dazzles Social Media
content: As of the last update, the video had gained over 98 million views and 5.5 million likes on Instagram alone.
summary: As of the last update, the video had gained over 98 million views and 5.5 million likes on Instagram alone.

title: Syria Civil War: All About Rebels Behind The Fall Of Bashar Al-Assad
content: Syrians woke up on Monday to an uncertain future, after rebels seized the capital Damascus, forcing President Bashar al-Assad to flee to Russia, ending 13 years of civil war, and five decades of iron-fisted Baath rule.
summary: Syrians woke up on Monday to an uncertain future, after rebels seized the capital Damascus, forcing President Bashar al-Assad to flee to Russia, ending 13 years of civil war, and five decades of iron-fisted Baath rule.

title: Experience Japanese School Life For Rs 17,000 In A 'One-Day Student' Tour
content: The experience aims to provide tourists with a taste of Japanese schools while boosting tourism in the region.
summary: The experience aims to provide tourists with a taste of Japanese schools while boosting tourism in the region.

title: Syrian Rebels Failed For 13 Years. How They Beat Assad Regime In 13 Days
content: The rebels in Syria fought against the Bashar al-Assad regime for 13 years but failed to dislodge him from power. And then in a lightning offensive that lasted less than 13 days, the five-decade rule of the Assad family was decimated
summary: The rebels in Syria fought against the Bashar al-Assad regime for 13 years but failed to dislodge him from power. And then in a lightning offensive that lasted less than 13 days, the five-decade rule of the Assad family was decimated

title: Mysterious 'Disease X' Outbreak Widens, UN Sends Health Team To Congo
content: More cases of a mysterious flu-like illness labeled "Disease X" were reported in the Democratic Republic of the Congo.
summary: More cases of a mysterious flu-like illness labeled "Disease X" were reported in the Democratic Republic of the Congo.

title: From Discrimination To Nobel, Japan's Atomic Bomb Survivors To Get Peace Prize
content: Survivors of the US atomic bombings of Japan will receive the Nobel Peace Prize on Tuesday but, after years of anti-nuclear campaigning and showing the world their scars, they still retain the painful memories of the discrimination they have faced.
summary: Survivors of the US atomic bombings of Japan will receive the Nobel Peace Prize on Tuesday but, after years of anti-nuclear campaigning and showing the world their scars, they still retain the painful memories of the discrimination they have faced.

title: Women Are Still Struggling To Make It Into The C-Suite In The UK
content: Women are increasingly being hired for the roles at companies that tend to lead to the CEO slot, but they're still largely missing at the highest rungs of British corporations.
summary: Women are increasingly being hired for the roles at companies that tend to lead to the CEO slot, but they're still largely missing at the highest rungs of British corporations.

title: King Charles, Queen Camilla Share Christmas Card Amid Health Challenges
content: King Charles III and Queen Camilla have extended their warm season greeting on Instagram amid the monarch's health struggles.
summary: King Charles III and Queen Camilla have extended their warm season greeting on Instagram amid the monarch's health struggles.

title: Haiti Gang Kills 110 People Over Suspected 'Witchcraft' On Leader's Child
content: At least 110 people were killed over the weekend in Haiti's Cite Soleil slum when a gang leader targeted elderly people he suspected of causing his child's illness through witchcraft, the National Human Right Defense Network said on Sunday.
summary: At least 110 people were killed over the weekend in Haiti's Cite Soleil slum when a gang leader targeted elderly people he suspected of causing his child's illness through witchcraft, the National Human Right Defense Network said on Sunday.

title: Author Climbs Bestsellers Chart After Post About Selling 2 Books Goes Viral
content: The post had garnered nearly 25 million views and more than 745,000 likes which catapulted Vicky Ball to the top of bestseller charts.
summary: The post had garnered nearly 25 million views and more than 745,000 likes which catapulted Vicky Ball to the top of bestseller charts.

title: Luxury Cars, Guns, Furniture: Syrians Loot Assad's Abandoned Palace
content: Videos circulating on social media show the rebels exploring a garage packed with high-end cars, including Mercedes-Benz, Ferraris, Porsches, Audis, and even armoured SUVs.
summary: Videos circulating on social media show the rebels exploring a garage packed with high-end cars, including Mercedes-Benz, Ferraris, Porsches, Audis, and even armoured SUVs.

title: Australia Deploys Anti-Semitism Police Taskforce After Attack On Synagogue
content: Australia is launching a federal police taskforce targeting anti-Semitism, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said on Monday, days after an arson attack on a Melbourne synagogue.
summary: Australia is launching a federal police taskforce targeting anti-Semitism, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said on Monday, days after an arson attack on a Melbourne synagogue.

title: Foreign Secretary Arrives In Dhaka To Hold Talks With Interim Government
content: Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri arrives in Dhaka on Monday morning to discuss bilateral relations between India and Bangladesh, officials said.
summary: Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri arrives in Dhaka on Monday morning to discuss bilateral relations between India and Bangladesh, officials said.

title: Rapper Jay-Z Accused Of Assaulting 13-Year-Old Along With Sean "Diddy" Combs
content: Rapper Jay-Z has vehemently denied the allegations, calling them "heinous" and urging the complainant to pursue criminal charges if the claims are true.

title: New York Police Releases Photos Of Suspect In UnitedHealthcare CEO Murder
content: New York authorities have released new photographs of the suspect accused of shooting and killing UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson in Midtown Manhattan.
summary: New York authorities have released new photographs of the suspect accused of shooting and killing UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson in Midtown Manhattan.

title: 2024 Set To Be Warmest Year On Record: European Climate Agency
content: The year 2024 is set to be the warmest on record and the first with an average temperature above 1.5 degrees Celsius, European climate agency Copernicus said on Monday.
summary: The year 2024 is set to be the warmest on record and the first with an average temperature above 1.5 degrees Celsius, European climate agency Copernicus said on Monday.

title: South Korea's Opposition Accuses Ruling Party Of 'Second Coup'
content: South Korea's opposition on Monday accused the ruling party of staging a "second coup" by clinging to power and refusing to impeach President Yoon Suk Yeol over his declaration of martial law.
summary: South Korea's opposition on Monday accused the ruling party of staging a "second coup" by clinging to power and refusing to impeach President Yoon Suk Yeol over his declaration of martial law.
